questions.question: How many paid leaves am I entitled to per year?
questions.answer: Employees are entitled to 15 days of paid leave annually, in addition to 12 days of casual leave and 10 public holidays.

questions.question: Can unused leaves be carried over to the next year?
questions.answer: Yes, up to 30 days of earned leave can be carried over to the following calendar year.

questions.question: What is the notice period for resignation?
questions.answer: The standard notice period is 30 days for full-time employees, unless otherwise stated in the employment contract.

questions.question: Are employees allowed to work from home?
questions.answer: Work-from-home is permitted with prior approval from the reporting manager and HR, based on role and business requirements.

questions.question: Does the company provide health insurance?
questions.answer: Yes, all full-time employees are covered under the company’s group health insurance policy, which includes hospitalization and maternity benefits.

questions.question: What is the policy on late attendance?
questions.answer: A grace period of 10 minutes is allowed. More than 3 late arrivals per month may result in a formal warning.

questions.question: How do I apply for leave?
questions.answer: Leave requests must be submitted via the HRMS portal at least 3 days in advance, except in case of emergencies.

questions.question: What is the dress code policy?
questions.answer: Business casual from Monday to Thursday and smart casuals on Fridays. Formal wear is required for client meetings.

questions.question: Does the company support training or certification programs?
questions.answer: Yes, employees can apply for upskilling reimbursements. Up to 50% of the cost is reimbursed for approved programs.

questions.question: Can I refer a friend for an open position?
questions.answer: Yes, through the Employee Referral Program. A referral bonus is credited once the referred candidate completes 3 months of employment.

questions.question: Is there a probation period for new employees?
questions.answer: Yes, the probation period is 6 months from the date of joining. It may be extended based on performance review.

questions.question: Are interns eligible for company benefits?
questions.answer: Interns are not eligible for medical or insurance benefits but may receive a stipend and training certificate.

questions.question: How do I raise a grievance with HR?
questions.answer: Employees can log grievances through the HR portal or email hr-support@company.com for confidential handling.

questions.question: What is the company’s policy on harassment?
questions.answer: The company follows a strict zero-tolerance policy on harassment. Incidents can be reported directly to the Internal Complaints Committee (ICC).
